title.narrative: JO-AMMAN SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT AND CARBON FINANCE

description.narrative: The development objectives of the proposed project are to strengthen the operational, financial, and environmental performance of MSWM in Amman. Specifically, the project will help achieve the following: (i) Environmentally upgrade and expand the existing municipal solid waste landfill to meet the cityâ€™s disposal needs up to 2013 and generate electricity while mitigating GHGs; and (ii) Improve the cost effectiveness of the existing municipal solid waste collection and transport system and improve overall cost recovery.

comment.narrative: Exact data cannot be collected due to weaknesses in the accounting system but the ratio is estimated at 70%.

title.narrative: 160,000 MWh produced and connected to the electricity grid by 2013 (cumulative)

comment.narrative: The start date for LFG collection operations is delayed to end June 2014. If GAM decides to proceed further with energyproduction,electricity could then be expected to be fed to the grid by the end of CY 2014.

title.narrative: 950,000 tons of CERs (as CO2 equivalent) generated by 2013 (cumulative)

comment.narrative: The start date for LFG collection operations is delayed to end June 2014, at which point CERs could start being generated but theEmissions Reduction Purchase Agreement with the Carbon Fund for Europe has lapsed.

title.narrative: Discharge from the leachate treatment facility meets Jordanian standards.

target.value: Discharge from the leachate treatment facility meets standards

comment.narrative: Leachate is properly collected and there is no discharge into the water streams. The last mission recommended specific treatmentofthe leachate from the lagoons.

title.narrative: MWh generated through the LFG recovery system (cumulative)

comment.narrative: Electricity will be generated once the gas production is underway. The system will be in place in part of the landfill by theproject closing date. Gas will be extracted in the amount of 1,200 m3/ hour .

title.narrative: Percentage of collected municipal solid waste disposed of and managed in a sanitary landfill

comment.narrative: Target exceeded.100% of the municipal waste collected is disposed of and managed in a sanitary landfill.

title.narrative: The ratio of KM travelled by collection vehicles in districts served by new transfer stations to the total tons of municipal waste collected in those districts (kms/tons) is reduced.

comment.narrative: The indicator was meant to be redefined in case of a restructuring, as it cannot be reliably calculated in the absence of a propertracking system. It is however estimated that the ratio has been reduced to about 4.0.

title.narrative: Disposal infrastructure constructed at Al Ghabawi landfill for a total capacity of 8 million tons of waste.
Information on financial and sector performance available for project and sector reporting.

target.value: Financial and sector performance reports produced.

comment.narrative: The detailed design and implementation of the new M&E system is still underway. This system will be linked to GAM's overall M&Esystem which explains the delays in the finalization of the software.
